alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 4:38AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Moderate rain from Thursday through Saturday morning has led to rises in the Little Popo Agie River. Rain is expected across the area through the day Saturday. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Little Popo Agie River, from the Red Canyon area south of Lander through Lyons Valley to Hudson. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Bankfull Stage. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 421 AM MDT, At 9 PM Friday, June 2, the river crested at 4.5 feet. This will cause small stream flooding. The river is expected to stay near flood stage. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen since Thursday afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hudson and Lyons Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
